modules.description: Handles HTTP connections by processing incoming requests and determining the appropriate response, such as closing the connection or upgrading to a WebSocket or h2c protocol. It operates on `Atacama.Connection.t` and `Trail.Request.t` types, producing a `response` that dictates the next action. This module is used to implement custom server behavior, such as routing requests or initiating protocol upgrades based on client headers.

This module defines a configuration structure for controlling request parsing limits and timeouts. It includes fields for maximum request line length, header count, header length, and request receive timeout. Use this structure to enforce constraints when processing HTTP-like requests in network services.

This module implements an HTTP server that manages connections, routes requests, and supports protocol upgrades, operating on types like `Atacama.Connection.t` and `Trail.Request.t` to produce responses that control connection behavior. It provides configuration options to set parsing limits and timeouts, ensuring robust handling of HTTP-like traffic. You can build REST APIs, customize request pipelines with middleware, and implement protocol upgrades such as WebSocket or h2c based on client headers. The combination of runtime handling and fine-grained configuration enables building scalable and secure network services with tailored request processing.
